title: From the ruins of the Trabant, how Volkswagen plans to rule Europe in electric cars
text:
The east German city of Zwickau has had a chequered history when it comes to cars. It was the birthplace of Audi, but in recent years the city is better known as the former home of Trabant, the plastic car with a two-stroke engine and a top speed of 62mph that became synonymous with the failures of communism.

If Volkswagen has its way, that may be about to change. The carmaker is intent on transforming the rundown former communist city far from the industrial powerhouses of west Germany into the European home of the electric car. Major works are underway at a massive complex just north of the city. VW is attempting something that has never been done before: converting an existing plant to electric...
description: The east German city of Zwickau has had a chequered history when it comes to cars.
